name: Carmichael
description:
Carmichael is back with a free gig! and you know what that means... it means you better get ready to dance! Revived and better than ever, this Pōneke based band blends rhythmic sounds of voice, horns, rhythm and bass to get you up and moving. We commence on Friday, 18th of July so tell your friends and bring your mothers - join us in the groove.

Music from 9:30, FREE ENTRY

id: My Pleasure By Bri Louise w/ Tui The Band And John Paul Jr.-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
name: My Pleasure By Bri Louise w/ Tui The Band And John Paul Jr.
description:
It is My Pleasure to invite you to a Bri Louise single release event for their new single “My Pleasure.” on the 19th of July starting at 9:30pm at The Rogue and Vagabond.

Bri Louise band consists of Bri Louise (vocal/keys), Molly Wyatt (flute/vocals), Becky Devine (bass), Theo Thompson (guitar), Eloise Edmond (Saxophone) and Ateo Buhne (drums). Bri Louise's band blends sultry queer R&B with smooth jazz and undeniable groove. Bri’s sound has roots in Gospel and Neo-Soul, evolving into a rich fusion of Jazz, Hip-Hop, R&B.

Supporting acts:

Tui the Band - a three piece Hi-Tek reggae band consisting of bassist Becky Devine, drummer Harper Champion and vocalist/guitarist Harry Young. The band merges electronic explorations with reggae making a unique experience spanning the many dialects of dub music. Echo drenched skanks meet heavy basslines and repetitive drum grooves that are bound to make you dance slow, low and easy!

John Paul Jr. - a DJ, musician, and producer from Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Drawing from soulful underground sounds, he fuses the warmth of boogie, jazz dance, rare disco, dub, and global rhythms with deep, percussive energy built for the dancers.

name: The Bigboyband
description:
Are you cold and miserable and tired and frumpy inside your damp and lonely hovels? Here's a better idea: be warm and happy and energised and uplifted inside the Rogue and Vagabond!

Everyone's favourite band of absolute sweethearts the BigBoyBand are back once again to bring warmth and joy and music with: Winter Wonderland. A full 15-piece big band with featured special guests are playing brand-new arrangements of your favourite snow-falling, up-by-the-fire-cozying, sled-riding, cold weather songs. Fun! Uplifting! Heartwarming! There's gonna be snow inside (just kidding)! And as always, bandleader Seth Boy has special fun secret super cool twists gimmicks activities up his sleeve, come to the Rogue on Thursday the 24th of July 9pm to find out : )

$10 online / $15 door sales / + raffle tix maybe? or something like that?

Music from 9pm

id: Good Luck Returns!-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
name: Good Luck Returns!
description:
We are back for round 2, exclusively making music to make you move. Good Luck, lead by Mads Taylor (Tahini Bikini) and Lee Stuart (Lee Stuart) is a double vocal lead 8 piece band once again bringing our disco house inspired beats live to the Rogue & Vagabond stage. Mark your calendars and set your reminders to loud cause you won’t want to miss out on this night!

Koha entry!

Vocals - Lee Stuart
Vocals - Mads Taylor
Guitar - Alex Esbee
Keys - Aidan McCulloch
Bass - Seth Boy
Precision - Eric Sebastian
Drums - Ryder Smith
Trumpet - Robbo

Music from 9:30pm

id: The Mixtape: Vol 6-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
name: The Mixtape: Vol 6
description:
LJ Crichton is back with The Mixtape: Vol 6. A night of RnB, Soul and Funk to heat up the city a bit.

Joined by some heavy musicians it’s gonna be a great night at the Rogue and Vagabond.

Free entry ?
Music from 9:30pm

id: Rogue Sunday Jazz - Emma Hattaway-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
name: Rogue Sunday Jazz - Emma Hattaway
description:
The Rogue's regular Sunday afternoon jazz. Funky, jazzy, soulful jazz. Beer, hangs, and jazz, on a Sunday, perfect!

This week featuring local bassist Emma Hattaway and her band.

Join Emma and friends for an evening celebrating two of jazz’s most original voices. One set explores the sharp, playful language of Thelonious Monk; the other dives into the bold, emotional world of Charles Mingus.

As if their voices weren’t daring enough, the band will explore new takes and outlandish arrangements of Monk and Mingus tunes—adding to the ongoing conversation these legends continue to inspire.

Music from 5pm, FREE ENTRY - koha for the band encouraged

id: The Hip Town Bangers-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
name: The Hip Town Bangers
description:
Wellington's hardest swinging quintet are back for another round at The Rogue and Vagabond. Last time was so much fun we just had to go in again!

Featuring:

Chris Buckland - tenor saxophone
Ben Hunt - trumpet
Anita Schwabe - piano
Emma Hattaway - bass
Mike Jensen - drums

Music from 9pm - FREE ENTRY, Koha for the band welcome!

name: Bojack Funkman
description:
Fronted by Ben Hunt, Kaito Walley, and Eilish Wilson (aka the Horn Section of Doom) with an all-star cast of rhythm section virtuosos, this crossover episode brings together Lettuce, Dave Guy, Ezra Collective, and some hometown bangers. Stay home? Neigh way, José!

Special guests: Jade Merematira (vocals) and Louis TM (vocals/keys)

Also featuring:

Ben Hunt - trumpet
Kaito Walley - trombone
Eilish Wilson - saxophone
Petar Tavich - guitar
Emma Hattaway - bass
Jacob Randall - drums

Music from 9:30, FREE ENTRY, koha for the band encouraged

id: Sunday Jazz - Callum Allardice-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
name: Sunday Jazz - Callum Allardice
description:
The Rogue's regular Sunday afternoon jazz. Funky, jazzy, soulful jazz. Beer and jazz, on a Sunday perfect!

This week featuring local guitarist Callum Allardice and his trio

Join the Callum Allardice trio for some favourite standards and standard inspired originals, featuring the talents of John Rae and Eli Mulheron.

Music from 5pm FREE ENTRY, koha for the band encouraged

name: ABACUS
description:
ABACUS is back at The Rogue & Vagabond on Thursday the 7th of August for a night you won’t forget! ABACUS is an ensemble brought together by their shared love of the music of Brazil. Brush up on your Portuguese and get ready to dance and sing along to tunes by legends like Tom Jobim, Jorge Ben Jor, Novos Baianos, and many more!

Featuring the talents of:

Alex Scott-Billing: Guitar
Lily Atu: Vocals / Saxophone
Star Stephens: Trumpet/ Vocals
Elina Chester: Keys
Jono Benzur: Bass
Eric Sebastian: Percussion
Ranu Wijesuriya: Drums

FREE ENTRY– music from 9 PM. Don’t miss out!

id: Undubbed Goes Rogue-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
name: Undubbed Goes Rogue
description:
An unpredictable live show blending electronica, breakbeat, hip-hop, and jazz improvisation.

UNDUBBED. is a three-piece band featuring Blair Gowan (keys), Ciaran Egan (drums), and Alex Cooper (bass).

Join them for a snug winter's night at the Rogue and Vagabond, where head-nod beats meet cinematic soundscapes.

Music from 9:00, FREE ENTRY

id: The Wellington City Shake-em-on-Downers-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
name: The Wellington City Shake-em-on-Downers
description:
From amidst the wreckage of our capitalist wasteland they rise, like a phoenix soaring through a bowl of molasses... The Wellington City Shake-em-on-Downers ARE BACK proving themselves to be the most resilient life form on the planet, giving even the cockroaches a run for their money. Middle New Zealand's favourite dadaist swing cult phenomenon are back with a vengeance, serving up a fiery primordial soup of fresh tunes for your listening and dancing 'pleasure'. Prepare for the stupidest gags, hottest horn solos, stonkiest grooves and pea-brained banter as we reign supreme in the battle of wits and people's attention against the existential crisis rectangle, otherwise know as the iPhone. Don't miss this exuberant show, or you may regret it for the rest of your miserable life.

----------------------------------------

General Admission: $15 +BF ($20 on the door)
Students/Unwaged: $10 +BF ($15 on the door)

LIVE at The Rogue & Vagabond, Wellington - Saturday 23rd August.

----------------------------------------

https://shake-em-on-down.bandcamp.com/album/on-the-menu

id: Vincent Vega Plays Tarintino-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
name: Vincent Vega Plays Tarintino
description:
A night of surf, soul and rockn'roll bangers from Quentin Tarantino's cult classic films, played with great vengeance & furious anger by Wellingtons favourite surf-rock saviours Vincent Vega. Expect tunes from Pulp Fiction, Reservoir Dogs, Once Upon A Time In Hollywood, The Hateful Eight, Death Proof and more.

Featuring special guests Lisa Tomlins on vocals and Louis TM on keys and vocals, as well as the usual suspects in Richard Te One (drums), Nick Lissette (bass) and Chris Armour (guitar)

Music from 9:30pm, FREE ENTRY
